Resume

Luke Sheard

I am an aspiring developer & product manager currently working towards an MMath degree reading mathematics at the University of California, Berkeley. After I graduate in summer of 2016 I plan on applying for a graduate program in computer science or for a job in San Francisco.

Work Experience

Worldwide September 2013 - Present
Freelance Designer
www.lukesheard.com

I have worked as a freelance designer and photographer since the summer of my second year of university. Specializing in events promotion and documentation, I've produced promotional material for various events around university societies; however I have also branched into do designing logos and websites.

As well as design work I have also been hired by York University Student's Union (YUSU) to cover their major events for the academic year: Live & Loud, the lead event each year for Fresher's week; and Summer Ball & Graduation Ball, attended by over 2000 students as an end of year celebration and graduation party for final year students.

The work has taught me how to balance paid positions and university studies as well as giving me a greater understanding of how to work with clients with in their time frames.

Fresh Dental York, UK June 2014 - August 2014
Project Design Intern
www.freshsmiles.co.uk

Across the summer between my sophomore and junior year of college I was given the opportunity of working with a team of web developers and a specialist client as a design intern designing and overseeing the creation of a completely new, custom built, website for Fresh Smiles (a private dental practice in York, UK.)

The position heavily revolved around using Adobe's Creative Cloud software to handle the look and feel of the site to pass on to the development team, some of whom were based in Sydney Australia for the duration of the project.

We worked closely on the color schemes, page layouts and content feel before creating a custom wordpress theme and back-end CMS so that the client could customize all the content they required uploading. This allowed the site to focus upon improving search engine ranking, thus generating more traffic and potential customers.

My position also included re-creating a fresh and modern from the old branding the company was using. These were used on the updated the social media pages for the company.

Goodricke College York, UK Elected for 2014
Creative Media Designer
www.goodricke.co.uk

Revitalization of the Freshers Week 2014 branding. I facilitated communication between Junior Common Room Committee members and appropriate subcommittees. I was the principal designer compiling ideas for social events throughout the spring and summer terms as well as assisting and training other members on use of Adobe Suite products.

National Trust Oxborough, UK Feburary - September 2013
Project Engineer Intern
www.nationaltrust.org.uk

Assigned to update sections of the Oxburgh Hall website using a custom content management system, the project involved capturing and creating appropriate photographic content as well as creating new content focused on drawing new clients.

Blurtit Norwich, UK Feburary - June 2011
Assistant Project Manager
www.blurtit.com

Working within team producing content for a web question and answer startup. My responsibilities included overseeing a team of five content writing interns, performing editorial work and liaising with the product manager about scheduling and matching content to audience.

Voluntary

B-Side Bay Area, CA August 2014 - Present
Head of Photography
www.berkeleybside.com

After some time as a photographer and writer for the magazine where I worked indepdendently and with other writers to produce reviews of live music shows around San Francisco, Oakland and Berkeley.

In the position of head of photography I am responsible for hiring new photographers and interviewing them as well as all editorial work for the department. I lias with the executive team about organizing live reviews and general quality of work by team memebers.

HAZsoc University of York, UK Feburary 2013 - May 2014
Founder & Vice Chair
www.berkeleybside.com

HAZsoc is a society based around creating communities and encouraging team work. The society organizes large campus games for students ,as well as social events, throughout the year with specific emphasis on bringing students who might not normally meet together.

The society mainly develops custom Humans vs. Zombies and Assassins Circle games. My role in the society was developing a Wordpress website, to host information about the games and the society, to outreach to similar societies in the UK and develop relations, as well as treasurer duties.

My term ended extremeley well. From founding in April of 2013 the society gained over 400 members within it's first full year. Wtih over 250 active memebers it is one of the largest operating societies at the University of York.

UC Berkeley

York, UK 2012-16
